name.text: Calculating the Height and Volume of a Square-Based Pyramid

questiontext.text:
The figure below shows a square-based pyramid

[[jsxgraph]] var brd = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, { boundingbox: [-2, 15, 12, -2], axis: false, axis: false, showNavigation: false, showCopyright: false }); // Base points (square, side 6cm) var A = brd.create('point', [2, 2], {fixed:true, visible:false}); var B = brd.create('point', [8, 2], {fixed:true,visible:false}); var C = brd.create('point', [8, 8], {fixed:true,visible:false}); var D = brd.create('point', [2, 8], {fixed:true,visible:false}); // Apex point (center above base, height 10cm) var Mx = (A.X() + B.X() + C.X() + D.X())/4; var My = (A.Y() + B.Y() + C.Y() + D.Y())/4; var E = brd.create('point', [Mx, My+10], {visible:false}); // Draw base brd.create('polygon', [A, B, C, D], { fillColor: 'blue', fillOpacity: 0.4, borders: {strokeColor: '#e51d6a', strokeWidth: 3} }); // Sides (faces) brd.create('polygon', [A, B, E], { fillColor: '#f9a', fillOpacity: 0.2, borders: {strokeColor: '#e51d6a', strokeWidth: 2} }); brd.create('polygon', [B, C, E], { fillColor: '#f9a', fillOpacity: 0.2, borders: {strokeColor: '#e51d6a', strokeWidth: 2} }); brd.create('polygon', [C, D, E], { fillColor: '#f9a', fillOpacity: 0.2, borders: {strokeColor: '#e51d6a', strokeWidth: 2} }); brd.create('polygon', [D, A, E], { fillColor: '#f9a', fillOpacity: 0.2, borders: {strokeColor: '#e51d6a', strokeWidth: 2} }); // Dashed hidden lines for perspective brd.create('segment', [A, C], {strokeColor:'#e51d6a', dash:2, strokeWidth:1}); brd.create('segment', [B, D], {strokeColor:'#e51d6a', dash:2, strokeWidth:1}); // Height (dashed vertical from base center to apex) var baseCenter = brd.create('point', [Mx, My], {visible: false}); brd.create('segment', [baseCenter, E], {strokeColor: '#000', dash:2, strokeWidth: 2}); // Right-angle indicator for height brd.create('polygon', [ brd.create('point', [Mx+0.5, My], {visible: false}), brd.create('point', [Mx+0.5, My+0.7], {visible: false}), brd.create('point', [Mx, My+0.7], {visible: false}), brd.create('point', [Mx, My+0], {visible: false}) ], {borders: {strokeColor: 'black'}, fillColor: 'black', fillOpacity: 0}); // Dimension labels brd.create('text', [ (A.X()+B.X())/2, A.Y() - 0.7, "{#a#} cm"], {fontSize: 16}); brd.create('text', [ (C.X()+D.X())/12, C.Y() -3, "{#a#} cm"], {fontSize: 16}); brd.create('text', [ E.X()-0.5, (baseCenter.Y()+E.Y())/2, "h"], {fontSize: 16}); brd.create('text', [E.X() - 1.5, (baseCenter.Y() + E.Y()) / 2, "{#L#} cm"], { fontSize: 16, rotate: 65 } ); [[/jsxgraph]]

Correct to the nearest whole, find:

  1. The vertical height of the pyramid.

    \(\text{Height(h)}=\)[[input:ans1]]\(\,\text{cm}\)[[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

  2. The volume of the pyramid.

    \(\text{Volume}=\)[[input:ans2]]\(\,\text{cm}^3\)[[validation:ans2]][[feedback:prt2]]

generalfeedback.text:
Solution

  1. Vertical height of the pyramid

    The base is a square of side \({@a@}\,\text{ cm}\), so half of the base side is:

    \( \begin{align} \text{half of base side} &= \frac{{@a@}}{2} \\ &= {@half_a@}\,\text{cm} \end{align} \)

    The slant height of the pyramid is {@L@} cm. Using Pythagorasâ€™ theorem in the right-angled triangle formed by the vertical height, half of the base side, and the slant height:

    \( \begin{align} h^2 &= L^2 - \left(\frac{a}{2}\right)^2 \\ h^2 &= ({@L@})^2 - ({@half_a@})^2 \\ h &= \sqrt{({@L@})^2 - ({@half_a@})^2}\\ &={@h@} \\ &={@height_val@}\\ &={@height_pyramid@}\,\text{cm} \end{align} \)

    Therefore,
    \( \begin{align} \text{h} &= {@Height_pyramid@}\,\text{cm} \end{align} \)

  2. Volume of the pyramid

    Area of the square base:
    \( \begin{align} \text{Base area} &= a^2 \\ &= ({@a@})^2 \\ &= {@Base_area@}\,\text{cm}^2 \end{align} \)

    Volume of a pyramid is given by:
    \( \begin{align} V &= \frac{1}{3} \times \text{Base area} \times h \\ &= \frac{1}{3} \times {@Base_area@} \times {@Height_pyramid@} \\ &={@volume_val@} \\ &={@volume_pyramid@} \, \text{cm}^3 \end{align} \)

    Therefore,
    \( \begin{align} \text{Volume} &= {@volume_pyramid@}\,\text{cm}^3 \end{align} \)

questionnote.text:
\(\text{The slant height of the pyramid}={@L@}\,\text{cm}\)

\(\text{The base side of the pyramid}={@a@}\,\text{cm}\)

\(\text{The vertical height of the pyramid}={@height_pyramid@}\,\text{cm}\)

\(\text{The volume of the pyramid}={@volume_pyramid@}\,\text{cm}\)
